alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 6:33PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL, SOUTHEASTERN SANTA FE AND NORTHEASTERN TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 633 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Stanley to 8 miles northwest of Clines Corners. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clines Corners and San Jose. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 200 and 231. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 320 and 322. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 245 and 271. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for central and northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Northeast Highlands
